item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 8, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Computer Architecture, Fifth Edition: A Quantitative Approach (66 points | 10 comments)
2. JSON5 – JSON for Humans (46 points | 39 comments)
3. Show HN: A portable hash map in C (54 points | 28 comments)
4. 1,600 Days of a Failed Hobby Data Science Project (19 points | 9 comments)
5. The Rules of Programming (2023) (27 points | 12 comments)
6. How to Measure Frequency Response of a Speaker at Home (9 points | 11 comments)
7. Chuck E. Cheese's animatronics band bows out (57 points | 28 comments)
8. VictoriaLogs: A Grafana Dashboard for AWS VPC Flow Logs – Migrating from Grafan (11 points | discuss)
9. Mise: Dev tools, env vars, task runner (190 points | 110 comments)
10. How much do I need to change my face to avoid facial recognition? (88 points | 86 comments)
11. Researchers use AI to turn sound recordings into street images (114 points | 39 comments)
12. UK bans daytime TV ads for cereals, muffins and burgers (164 points | 138 comments)
13. Show HN: Cut the crap – remove AI bullshit from websites (168 points | 98 comments)
14. Insects rely on sounds made by distressed vegetation to guide reproduction (156 points | 132 comments)
15. Qutebrowser: A keyboard-driven, Vim-like browser (89 points | 46 comments)
16. Derivative at a Discontinuity (31 points | 19 comments)
17. SQLite changed temp file prefix after McAfee users called devs to complain (2006) (141 points | 46 comments)
18. Small AI Chip Maker Marvell Now More Valuable Than Intel (77 points | 45 comments)
19. Zizmor would have caught the Ultralytics workflow vulnerability (61 points | 17 comments)
20. Replace Philips Hue Automation with Home Assistant's (13 points | 1 comment)
21. Mend it Mark gets suspect copyright strike for £25k audio amp repair (216 points | 81 comments)
22. Codenames App, or my biggest project so far (64 points | 10 comments)
23. Ask HN: What are the best programmable holiday lights? (111 points | 55 comments)
24. Douglas Crockford Is Not Your Dad (73 points | 90 comments)
25. The Need to Grind Concrete Examples Before Jumping Up a Level of Abstraction (140 points | 51 comments)
26. Flappy Bird in 1000 lines of C (122 points | 41 comments)
27. How do I pay the publisher of a web page? (49 points | 86 comments)
28. "BGP at home": getting a DIA circuit installed at home (200 points | 51 comments)
29. Linux EFI Zboot Abandoning "Compression Library Museum", Focusing on Gzip, ZSTD (49 points | 11 comments)
30. Show HN: Replace CAPTCHAs with WebAuthn passkeys for bot prevention (14 points | 8 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 8, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
